subskills.DESCRIPTION: Sort common tools into categories based on their primary function (measuring, cutting, joining, etc.)
Demonstrate safe handling and storage of three basic classroom tools
Match specific tools to the jobs they help accomplish (e.g., scissors for cutting, magnifier for observing)
Compare old and new versions of the same tool (e.g., manual vs. electric pencil sharpener)
Identify which sense each tool helps enhance (magnifier-sight, stethoscope-hearing, etc.)
Use simple measuring tools to compare two objects (ruler, balance scale, measuring cups)
Draw and label three parts of a common tool used in the classroom
Explain how weather tools help us prepare for different conditions (thermometer, wind sock, rain gauge)
Select appropriate protective gear for different activities (goggles, gloves, apron)
Document observations using digital tools (tablet camera, simple recording device)
Create a simple device to solve a classroom problem using available materials
Compare the effectiveness of different tools for the same task (different types of scissors, different magnifiers)
